alert.note: Alert for Ionia (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 05 at 9:16PM EDT until April 07 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Rapids MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... Grand River at Portland affecting Ionia County. For the Grand River...including Portland...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Grand River at Portland. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening to early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Expect minor flooding in the Village of Lyons and low lying areas adjacent to the river. Two Rivers Park in Portland becomes flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 11.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Wednesday evening to a crest of 12.1 feet just after midnight. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest is above a previous crest of 11.3 feet on May 19 2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr.
